title: Six-year-old dies just hours after contracting 'worst case of meningitis' doctors have ever seen - Mirror Online
text:

A six-year-old girl died after suffering one of the ‘worst cases of meningitis ’ medics have ever seen. 
Layla Rose Ermenekli passed away just hours after showing symptoms of the aggressive disease. 
She was rushed to A&E on Friday evening with a high temperature, headache and stomach ache - but by Saturday morning, she had died. 
Friends are now raising money to support the family, and have already reached £8,000 of their £10,000 target. 
The youngster, who was a talented dancer, quickly deteriorated, and was put on an antibiotic drip, reports the Manchester Evening News . She was admitted to hospital with a high temperature, headache and stomach ache (Photo: MEN) Layla-Rose with her mum Kirsty on a visit to Turkey (Photo: MEN) Read More Mum feared daughter had MENINGITIS after Wilko bath bomb 'caused horrifying rash over her body' 
On Saturday morning her heart stopped and she was resuscitated, but tragically ‘fell asleep’ shortly afterwards. 
Family friend Hannah Morrey, who danced with Layla Rose, her older sister Melika, and Kirsty, described the Oasis Academy Limeside pupil as an ‘incredible little girl’ with a ‘beautiful smile and infectious laugh’. 
Hannah spoke to the M.E.N on behalf of Layla Rose’s family, who live in Oldham. 
She said: “I met Layla Rose and her mum and sister through dancing. I dance in a troupe based in Stoke-on-Trent called Crystal Shandelles, and they danced for Collettes in Oldham . Little Layla-Rose passed away on Saturday morning after her heart stopped (Photo: MEN) 
“She had this cheeky, infectious laugh and beautiful smile and absolutely loved her little dancing friends.” 
Hannah explained that Layla had appeared fine during the day and had even been to school before she was rushed to hospital on Friday night. 
She added: “She fell asleep smiling at her mummy like she always did. 
“Doctors confirmed it was the worst case of meningitis that Royal Oldham Hospital has ever seen.” 
Hannah launched a fundraising page to support the family and in just several hours it had already raised £4,000. 
The total now stands at just over £8,000, but Hannah hopes to get it to £10,000. Read More Brave five-year-old triple amputee copies his doting sister to help him get used to life without limbs Kirsty Ermenekli and her fellow dancers gathered on Saturday, lit candles and shared their memories of her daughter (Photo: MEN) Hundreds of balloons were released by more than 10 dance troupes across the country in memory of Layla-Rose (Photo: MEN) 
“I just felt helpless after Layla-Rose passed away. No amount of money can bring her back but I thought it would be one less thing Kirsty would need to think about. 
“No one should have to bury their child, or worry about how they can fund the best send off their baby deserves. 
“Money shouldn’t have to be an issue at a time like this. However they choose to spend the money I would be happy knowing I’ve been able to do a little something for my friend and her family through this heartbreaking time.” 
On Sunday Crystal Shandelles released more than 100 balloons into the sky in memory of the youngster. 
To donate, visit www.justgiving.com/crowdfunding/Layla-rose-x
